context: Forward-facing dash-cam view of a two-lane urban street with a dedicated bike lane on the right side.
perception: The vehicle is traveling on a two-lane street with one lane in each direction. There is a marked bike lane on the right side of the road, separated by a solid white line. Parked cars line the right side of the street beyond the bike lane. A yellow diamond-shaped sign indicates a speed bump ahead with a recommended speed of 15 mph. The road surface appears clear and dry. There is a traffic light visible in the distance, currently green. No pedestrians or cyclists are immediately visible in the lane or crossing the street. The weather is clear with good visibility.
prediction: The vehicle will approach the speed bump and should reduce speed accordingly. Traffic ahead is moving steadily through the green light. No immediate hazards are visible.
planning: Slow down to comply with the 15 mph speed bump warning, maintain lane position, and continue straight while monitoring the traffic light and surroundings for any changes.
